name: Jauth
description: Jauth is a lightweight SSL/TLS reverse proxy with authorization via Telegram and SSH for self-hosted apps. It provides secure access control and authentication for web applications with minimal configuration and modern authorization methods.

deployment.justification: Simple Go binary with minimal configuration. Telegram and SSH integration is straightforward to set up.

features.name: Focus
features.value: Lightweight reverse proxy with modern authentication

features.name: Target Use Case
features.value: Self-hosted applications requiring secure access control

name: Lighttpd
description: Lighttpd is a secure, fast, compliant, and very flexible web server that has been optimized for high-performance environments. It provides efficient resource usage, advanced features, and excellent performance for serving static and dynamic content.

deployment.justification: Flexible configuration system with many options. Requires understanding of web server concepts for optimal setup.

features.name: Target Use Case
features.value: High-performance static and dynamic content serving

name: Nginx Proxy Manager
description: Nginx Proxy Manager is a Docker container for managing Nginx proxy hosts with a simple, powerful interface. It provides an easy-to-use web interface for configuring reverse proxies, SSL certificates, and access control without complex command-line configuration.

deployment.justification: Docker-based deployment with intuitive web interface. No command-line configuration required.

features.name: Target Use Case
features.value: Easy reverse proxy setup with web interface

name: NGINX
description: NGINX is a high-performance HTTP and reverse proxy server, mail proxy server, and generic TCP/UDP proxy server. Known for its stability, rich feature set, simple configuration, and low resource consumption, it powers many of the world's busiest websites.

deployment.justification: Flexible configuration system with extensive options. Requires understanding of web server and proxy concepts for optimal setup.

features.name: Focus
features.value: High-performance web server and reverse proxy

name: OAuth2 Proxy
description: OAuth2 Proxy is a flexible, open-source tool that can act as either a standalone reverse proxy or a middleware component integrated into existing reverse proxy or load balancer setups. It provides a simple and secure way to protect web applications with OAuth2/OIDC authentication by intercepting requests and redirecting users to OAuth2 providers for authentication.

deployment.justification: Requires OAuth provider setup and configuration. Well-documented but involves understanding of OAuth2/OIDC concepts.

features.name: Target Use Case
features.value: Protecting web applications with OAuth2 authentication

features.name: Architecture
features.value: Go + OAuth2/OIDC + Reverse proxy + Multiple providers

name: Pomerium
description: Pomerium is an identity-aware reverse proxy that provides secure access to internal applications. It acts as a successor to oauth_proxy by inserting an OAuth step before proxying requests to backends, enabling safe exposure of self-hosted websites to the public internet.

deployment.justification: Requires OAuth provider setup and identity configuration. Well-documented but involves security concepts.

features.name: Focus
features.value: Identity-aware reverse proxy with OAuth integration

features.name: Target Use Case
features.value: Secure access to internal applications with identity verification

features.name: Architecture
features.value: Go + OAuth providers + Policy engine + Reverse proxy

name: SafeLine
description: SafeLine is a web application firewall and reverse proxy designed to protect web applications from attacks and exploits. It provides comprehensive security features including threat detection, attack prevention, and real-time monitoring with easy deployment through Docker.

deployment.justification: Docker deployment with security configuration. Requires understanding of web application security concepts.

features.name: Focus
features.value: Web application firewall with comprehensive threat protection

features.name: Target Use Case
features.value: Web application security and attack prevention

features.name: Architecture
features.value: Docker + WAF engine + Reverse proxy + Security modules

name: Static Web Server
description: Static Web Server is a cross-platform, high-performance, and asynchronous web server for static file serving. Built with Rust, it provides blazing-fast performance, modern features, and excellent resource efficiency for serving static content.

deployment.justification: Single binary with simple configuration. Designed for easy deployment with sensible defaults.

features.name: Architecture
features.value: Rust + Async I/O + Static file optimization

name: SWAG (Secure Web Application Gateway)
description: SWAG is an Nginx webserver and reverse proxy with PHP support, built-in Certbot (Let's Encrypt) client and fail2ban integration. It provides a comprehensive solution for secure web hosting with automatic SSL certificates and intrusion prevention.

deployment.justification: Docker deployment with multiple integrated services. Requires configuration of SSL, reverse proxy, and security features.

features.name: Focus
features.value: Secure web gateway with integrated security features

features.name: Target Use Case
features.value: Secure web hosting with automatic SSL and intrusion prevention

name: Traefik
description: Traefik is an HTTP reverse proxy and load balancer that makes deploying microservices easy. It automatically discovers services, provides automatic SSL certificates, and offers a modern approach to traffic routing with support for multiple backends and orchestrators.

deployment.justification: Modern configuration with service discovery. Requires understanding of labels/annotations and routing concepts.

features.name: Focus
features.value: Modern reverse proxy with automatic service discovery

name: Varnish
description: Varnish is a web application accelerator and caching HTTP reverse proxy. It sits in front of web servers and caches content in memory, dramatically improving website performance by serving cached content instead of repeatedly processing requests on backend servers.

deployment.justification: Requires understanding of caching concepts and VCL configuration. Performance tuning needs expertise.

features.name: Focus
features.value: High-performance web application accelerator and cache

features.name: Target Use Case
features.value: Website performance optimization through intelligent caching

features.name: Architecture
features.value: C + In-memory cache + VCL configuration language

name: Zoraxy
description: Zoraxy is a general purpose HTTP reverse proxy and forwarding tool. It provides a simple yet powerful solution for routing HTTP traffic, load balancing, and managing web services with an intuitive web interface and flexible configuration options.

deployment.justification: Simple Go binary with web interface. Easy setup with minimal configuration required.

features.name: Focus
features.value: General purpose HTTP reverse proxy and forwarding

features.name: Target Use Case
features.value: Simple HTTP traffic routing and load balancing

name: AmuseWiki
description: AmuseWiki is a library-oriented wiki engine and publishing platform focused on high-quality text archiving and printing capabilities, with support for multiple output formats including PDF and EPUB.

deployment.justification: Requires Perl environment setup, database configuration, and understanding of LaTeX for advanced features. More complex than typical wiki platforms.

name: BookStack
description: BookStack is a self-hosted platform for organizing and storing information in a book-like structure, perfect for documentation, wikis, and knowledge management.

deployment.justification: Requires web server, PHP, and MySQL/MariaDB setup. Well-documented installation process with Docker options available.

name: Django Wiki
description: Django Wiki is a mature wiki system built for Django that offers complex functionality with simple integration and a superb interface, using Django models as its foundation.

deployment.justification: Requires Django environment setup and database configuration. Docker deployment available but configuration can be complex for advanced features.

name: Docmost
description: Docmost is an open-source collaborative wiki and documentation software that provides real-time collaboration, diagrams support, and enterprise features as an alternative to Confluence and Notion.

deployment.justification: Requires Node.js environment setup and database configuration. Docker deployment available but may need additional configuration for enterprise features.

name: Documize
description: Documize is a modern, self-hosted, enterprise-grade knowledge management solution built with Go and EmberJS, designed to unify both customer-facing and internal documentation.

deployment.justification: Requires database setup (PostgreSQL, MySQL or SQL Server) and Go environment. Docker deployment available but configuration needed for advanced features.

name: DokuWiki
description: DokuWiki is a simple to use and highly versatile Open Source wiki software that doesn't require a database. It is loved by users for its clean and readable syntax and appreciated by administrators for its easy maintenance and integration capabilities.

deployment.justification: No database required, uses file system storage. Simple PHP installation with minimal configuration needed.

name: Feather Wiki
description: Feather Wiki is a tiny, self-contained JavaScript wiki that runs in the browser. At just 58KB, it's like TiddlyWiki but as small as possible, offering a lightning-fast tool for creating non-linear notebooks, databases and wikis.

deployment.justification: Single HTML file that runs in the browser. No installation or server required.

name: Gitit
description: Gitit is a wiki program written in Haskell that uses Happstack for the web server and pandoc for markup processing, with pages stored in git, darcs, or mercurial repositories.

deployment.justification: Requires Haskell environment setup and database configuration. Docker deployment available but configuration needed for advanced features.

name: Gollum
description: Gollum is a simple Git-based wiki system that allows for human-editable text/markup files, flexible organization, and support for multiple markup languages.

deployment.justification: Requires Ruby/JRuby environment setup and Git configuration. Docker deployment available but some setup needed for advanced features.

name: MediaWiki
description: MediaWiki is a free and open-source wiki software package written in PHP. It serves as the platform for Wikipedia and other Wikimedia projects, used by hundreds of millions of people each month.

deployment.justification: Requires PHP environment setup and database configuration. Installation process is well-documented but involves multiple steps.

name: Mycorrhiza Wiki
description: Mycorrhiza Wiki is a lightweight file-system wiki engine that uses Git for keeping history. It stores content in plain files and features a unique markup language called Mycomarkup.

deployment.justification: No database required, uses filesystem storage. Simple installation with single binary or Docker.

name: OtterWiki
description: An Otter Wiki is a minimalistic Python-based wiki software that stores content in git repositories and uses Markdown for markup. Built with Flask and featuring a clean interface with dark mode support.

deployment.justification: Simple deployment via Docker Compose with minimal configuration required. Git-based storage requires no database setup.

name: Pepperminty Wiki
description: A complete wiki engine contained in a single PHP file. Features include file upload, page revision history, page tags, and more - all while being lightweight and easy to deploy.

deployment.justification: Single PHP file installation with minimal configuration required. Docker deployment also available.

name: Raneto
description: Raneto is a free, open-source Markdown-powered knowledge base platform built on Node.js. It uses static Markdown files to create documentation without requiring a database.

deployment.justification: Simple Node.js application with no database required. Installation involves basic npm commands.

name: TiddlyWiki
description: TiddlyWiki is a unique non-linear personal web notebook that anyone can use and keep forever, independently of any corporation. It's a complete interactive wiki in JavaScript that can be used as a single HTML file in the browser or as a Node.js application.

deployment.justification: Can be used as a single HTML file in browser or installed via npm for Node.js version. Multiple deployment options available.

name: Wiki.js
description: Wiki.js is a modern, lightweight wiki platform built with Node.js that offers powerful editing, beautiful themes, and Git-based storage for collaborative knowledge management.

deployment.justification: Requires database setup and Node.js environment. Docker deployment available but configuration can be complex for advanced features.

name: XWiki
description: XWiki is an advanced open source enterprise wiki platform written in Java. It features a powerful WYSIWYG editor, strong rights management, and extensive customization capabilities through its extension system.

deployment.justification: Requires Java environment setup and database configuration. Docker deployment available but setup needed for advanced features.
